title: 100 Influential Women award winners make mentoring a priority
text:
The striking feature of this year’s The Australian Financial Review 100 Women of Influence awards isn’t that all the winners are successful women. It is that they help others to be successful as well.

There was a strong theme of bigger purpose in this year’s winners. The 11 category winners were led by University of Sydney academic Julie Leask, who is renowned for global research into vaccination uptake. Her work is about targeting the much bigger group, beyond the committed anti-vaxxers, who are genuinely hesitant, or don’t have proper access to health services.

Women of Influence flows from the Financial Review’s mission statement: that Australia’s success comes from giving everyone access and opportunity. And Women of Influence is more than one night of the year. There are now 700 alumni working in a permanent active network to help women in community and business-based ventures.
description: The awards now have a strong theme of successful women bringing others along with them.
